alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Bernalillo. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 435 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over Albuquerque South Valley and near the Sunport. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tijeras Arroyo & South Diversion Channel, Rio Grande / Isleta Drain, Rio Grande / San Jose Drain, Rio Grande / Albuquerque Riverside Drain, Rio Grande / Pajarito Lateral, Rio Grande / Albq Riverside Drain, Arenal Main Canal / Isleta Drain, Barelas Ditch / Albq Riverside Drain, Gun Club Lateral, Los Padillas Drain / Acequia, Tijeras Arroyo, Gun Club Lateral / Isleta Drain, Arenal Main Canal / Indian Lateral and Barr Main Canal / Atrisco Drain. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Albuquerque and South Valley. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 211 and 223. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
